alert.note: Alert for Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 26 at 12:41AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Narrow line of heavier snow showers will impact portions of central Smith, Franklin, northeastern Phelps, western Kearney and southwestern Buffalo Counties through 130 AM CST... At 1236 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a narrow line of moderate to briefly heavy snow showers along a line extending from near Odessa to 7 miles southwest of Upland to near Franklin. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Brief bursts of moderate to heavy snow along a narrow line. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Plan on quick reductions in visibility along with slippery road conditions. Locations impacted include... Smith Center, Franklin, Elm Creek, Axtell, Odessa, Hildreth, Wilcox, Amherst, Upland, Bloomington, Riverton and Bellaire. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 259 and 271. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow covered roads and reduced visibility.
